perturbation.original_text: 4.1 The Executive shall serve as Chief Medical Officer and Senior Vice President, Development (reporting to Rick Winningham) or in such other role as the Company may determine.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 The Employee shall serve as Chief Medical Officer and Senior Vice President, Development (reporting to Rick Winningham) or in such other role as the Corporation may determine.
perturbation.explanation: The terms “Executive”, “Company” are changed to “Employee” and “Corporation” respectively. This creates uncertainty as to which entity is being referred to, potentially creating confusion on who is bound by the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 7.1 The Executive shall be paid a basic salary of £448,903 per annum subject to deductions required by law. The Executive's salary shall accrue from day to day, shall be payable in equal monthly instalments in arrears on or about the last day of each month. 7.2 The salary paid to the Executive will be reviewed on or around 1 April 2021. The Company is under no obligation to award an increase following a salary review.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 The Staff member shall be paid a basic compensation of £448,903 per annum subject to deductions required by law. The Executive's salary shall accrue from day to day, shall be payable in equal monthly instalments in arrears on or about the last day of each month. 7.2 The compensation paid to the Staff member will be reviewed on or around 1 April 2021. The Corporation is under no obligation to award an increase following a compensation review.
perturbation.explanation: The term “Executive” is changed to “Staff member” and “salary” to compensation in sections 7.1 and 7.2, and 'Company' to 'Corporation' without defining if they mean the same thing as mentioned in section 4.1, which can create confusion and uncertainty about which provisions applies to which parties, especially if there are changes in duties or responsibilities for staff members as compared to executives.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 The Executive shall be entitled to 28 days' paid holiday in each holiday year (which includes public holidays) to be taken at times convenient to the Company and authorised in advance. 12.2 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December. If the Executive's employment commences or terminates part way through a holiday year, the Executive's entitlement during that holiday year shall be calculated on a pro rata basis rounded up to the nearest whole day.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 The Employee shall be entitled to 28 days' paid time-off in each holiday year (which includes public holidays) to be taken at times convenient to the Corporation and authorised in advance. 12.2 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December. If the Staff member's employment commences or terminates part way through a holiday year, the Executive's entitlement during that holiday year shall be calculated on a pro rata basis rounded up to the nearest whole day.
perturbation.explanation: Here, “Executive” is changed to “Employee”, “Company” to “Corporation” and “Holiday” to “Time-off” which may or may not mean the same. Also, “Staff member” and “Executive” are used in a single paragraph that creates ambiguity as to whether these different terms entail the same provisions which might result in conflicting interpretations regarding employee benefits and entitlements.
